headline.main: DATA ON WEATHER CUT DOWN BY WAR; La Guardia Field Bureau Now Gives Only Local Forecast

lead_paragraph: The Department of Commerce's weather bureau station at La Guardia Field has restricted distribution of transatlantic weather reports it was learned yesterday. Before the airport was opened in December, 1939, it had been planned to correlate and distribute weather information from all over the world.
abstract: LaGuardia Field weather station restricts distribution of transatlantic repts
